title: mail
name: mail
description: Sends e-mail messages by an SMTP server.

attributes.name: from
attributes.description: The sender of the e-mail message.

attributes.name: to
attributes.description: The name of the e-mail message recipient.

attributes.name: cc
attributes.description: Indicates addresses to copy the e-mail message to; "cc" stands for "carbon copy."

attributes.name: bcc
attributes.description:
Indicates addresses to copy the e-mail message to, without listing them in the message header.
		"bcc" stands for "blind carbon copy."

attributes.name: replyto
attributes.description: Address(es) to which the recipient is directed to send replies.

attributes.name: failto
attributes.description: Address to which mailing systems should send delivery failure notifications. Sets the mail envelope reverse-path value.

attributes.name: subject
attributes.description:
The subject of the mail message. This field may be driven dynamically on
		a message-by-message basis

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Specifies extended type attributes for the message.

attributes.name: maxRows
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum number of e-mail messages to send.

attributes.name: mimeattach
attributes.description:
Specifies the path of the file to be attached to the e-mail message. An attached file
		is MIME-encoded.

attributes.name: query
attributes.description:
The name of the cfquery from which to draw data for message(s) to send. Specify this
		attribute to send more than one mail message, or to send the results of a query within a message.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description:
Specifies the query column to use when you group sets of records together to send as an e-mail
		message. For example, if you send a set of billing statements to customers, you might group on
		"Customer_ID." The group attribute, which is case sensitive, eliminates adjacent duplicates when the
		data is sorted by the specified field. See the Usage section for exceptions.

attributes.name: groupCaseSensitive
attributes.description:
Boolean indicating whether to group with regard to case or not. The default value is NO;
		case is considered while grouping. If the query attribute specifies a query object that was generated
		by a case-insensitive SQL query, set the groupCaseSensitive attribute to NO to keep the recordset
		intact.

attributes.name: startRow
attributes.description: Specifies the row in the query to start from.

attributes.name: server
attributes.description:
The address of the SMTP server to use for sending messages. If no server is specified, the
		server name specified in the Lucee Administrator is used.

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: The TCP/IP port on which the SMTP server listens for requests. This is normally 25.

attributes.name: mailerID
attributes.description:
Specifies a mailer ID to be passed in the X-Mailer SMTP header, which identifies the mailer
		application.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The number of seconds to wait before timing out the connection to the SMTP server.

attributes.name: username
attributes.description: A user name to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a password attribute.

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: A password to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a username attribute.

attributes.name: wraptext
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Character encoding of the mail message

attributes.name: async
attributes.description:
if set to true, the mail is sent asynchronously by the Lucee Task manager (with multiple tries),
			if set to false the mail is sent in the same thread that executes the request, which is useful for troubleshooting because you get an error message if there is one.
			This setting overrides the setting with the same name in the Lucee Administrator.
			This attribute replaces the old "spoolenable" attribute which is still supported as an alias.

attributes.name: usetls
attributes.description: Whether to use Transport Level Security.

attributes.name: priority
attributes.description:
The message priority level. Can be one of the following values:
    * An integer in the range 1-5; 1 represents the highest priority.
    * One of the following string values, which correspond to the numeric values: highest or urgent, high, normal, low, and lowest or non-urgent.

attributes.name: usessl
attributes.description: Whether to use Secure Sockets Layer.

attributes.name: proxyServer
attributes.description: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

attributes.name: proxyPort
attributes.description:
The port number on the proxy server from which the object is requested. Default is 80. When
	used with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically
	resolved to preserve links in the retrieved document.

attributes.name: proxyUser
attributes.description: When required by a proxy server, a valid username.

attributes.name: proxyPassword
attributes.description: When required by a proxy server, a valid password.

attributes.name: remove
attributes.description: remove all attachments from filesystem after the mail is successfully sent

attributes.name: sendTime
attributes.description: Set a future date time to send an email in the future via the spooler.
